page.topic: How to Set the Height of a Container to the Screen Height

discussion.p: If you try the set the height of a Container in a UX Component to 100% of the screen using *[css:height: 100%;]*, it won't work. This is because percentage (%) is a relative unit, so the resulting heigh of the Container will be relative to the object that contains it.

figure.title: The container height is limited to the height of it's parent object. In this image, the parent object is the UX Component.

description.p: To set the height of the container to the full height of the screen, you can use the *[ui:screen.height]* variable. The *[ui:screen.height]* variable will size the height of the container to the height of the screen.

section.important: You cannot use *[ui:screen.height]* when defining the in-line style for the container. You can only use screen.height in the [Height property].
